comments:
Description:
  Nest query with data set parameter binding will cause an error message,since the column "CA" has null value.

Steps to reproduce:
  1.New a sampledb data source and dataset, and input ?select distinct
CLASSICMODELS.CUSTOMERS.STATE from CLASSICMODELS.CUSTOMERS? in the Query of
dataset.
  2.New another sampledb data source and dataset, and input ?select *from
CLASSICMODELS.CUSTOMERS where CLASSICMODELS.CUSTOMERS.STATE=?? in the Query of
dataset. Go to the parameters pane and set a default value ?CA? to the param1. 
  3. Drag the first dataset to the layout to get a 1*2 table.(refer to the
attached design file)
  4. Drag the second dataset to the detail row and get a table nest table(inner
table have its binding)
  5. Choose the inner table and go to the binding tab, click the button
?Dataset Parameter Binding?
  6. Set the param1 value: row._outer["STATE"]
  7. Save and preview it


change the bingding expression as 'row["STATE"]' is verified 

but still has another error messange when review the report.

Created an attachment (id=41839)
The design file
Do we need to fix this one in 2.1?

This issue cannot resolved until null value can be accepted as ODA input parameter value. See related bug 122210 and bug 122121.

As a workaround, the inner query's binding expression can be modified to:
   row._outer["STATE"] == null? "" : row._outer["STATE"]

Added support in BIRT Data Engine odaconsumer layer to set a null value to a scalar input parameter.  It triggers calls to an underlying ODA driver that implements related ODA interface methods introduced in BZ 122121.
The parameter can accept null value now. But due to the jdbc driver's issue, sometimes it cannot return the corret result when using null value as a parameter's value.

traces.message: Default value for input parameter cannot be null.
